action.action-desc: Mrs. Lee of Nevada (for herself and Mr. Fitzpatrick) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To reauthorize the program for mental health awareness training grants, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expanding Access to Mental Health Training Act.

section.header: Reauthorization of mental health awareness training grants
section.text: Section 520J(b) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 290bb–41(b)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting youth and their after to refer;

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in subparagraph (B)(ii), by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
suicide intervention and prevention, including recognizing warning signs and referring someone for help, including referrals for culturally and linguistically appropriates services.

paragraph.text: by inserting after paragraph (6) the following:
The Secretary may provide technical assistance to grantees in carrying out this section, which may include assistance with—

subparagraph.text: program evaluation and improvement, as necessary;
dissemination and implementation of evidence-based programs;
facilitating collaboration and information sharing among grantees; and
other activities as the Secretary determines appropriate.

paragraph.text: in paragraph (8), as so redesignated, by striking $14,693,000 for each of fiscal years 2018 through 2022 and inserting $54,963,000 for each of fiscal years 2023 through 2027.
